title: Quiz 2 - Percentage
instruction: Directions (46-50): The following questions are accompanied by three statements (A ) or (I), (B ) or (II), and (C ) or (III).You have to determine which statement(s) is/are sufficient/necessary to answer the questions.

quiz.text: Aditya has some amount out of which 25% of it is stolen in bus, 10% he gave to his friend, 50% of reminder is spend in party and rest Rs. 26 gave to his mother. What was his initial amount?
options: 1230
80
160
90
None of these

quiz.text: If A’s salary is 20% higher than B then how much B salary is less than A’s salary?
options: 20%
25%
16.67%
None of these

quiz.text: If a number is increased by 20% and then reduced by 20% after this operation the number?
options: does not change
increase by 1%
4% increase
4% decrease
1% decrease

quiz.text: If  of a number is 23 more than 50% of the same number, then what will be 80% of the number?
options: 184
174
23
230
None of these

quiz.text: Two numbers is respectively 20% and 30% less than third number. What is the second number as a percentage of the first?
options: 87.5%
88%
77.5%
87%
97.5%

quiz.text: The sum of two number is  of the first number. The second number is what percent of the first?
options: 5%
10%
15%
20%
None of these

quiz.text: In an examination it is required to multiple by a number with 7 but by mistake a Student divide it by 7 then what is error percent?
options: 7%
97.96%
91%
49%
None of these

quiz.text: 405 toffees were distributed equally among children in such a way that the number of toffees received by each child is 20% of the total number of children. How many toffees did each child got?
options: 40
30
42
55
None of these

quiz.text: Ram scored 30% marks and failed by 15 marks. Aditya score 40% marks  and obtained 35 marks more than those of required to pass. The pass percentage is?
options: 33%
38%
43%
46%
None of these

quiz.text: The price of sugar is  reduced by 2% how many kg of sugar can now be bought for the money which was sufficient to buy 49 kg of sugar earlier?
options: 1 kg more
1 kg less
2 kg more
2 kg less
None of these

quiz.text: Aditya salary is 125% of Ram salary. Sanjay salary is 80% of Ram salary. If the total of all the three salaries is Rs. 61000. What is Sanjay salary?
options: 10000
12000
15000
16000
None of  these

quiz.text: If a is 150% of B then B is what percent of A+B?
options: 30%
35%
40%
45%
None of these

quiz.text: If in the examination 20% failed in Hindi, 25% failed in English and 7% failed in both subject then the percentage of student who failed in at most one of the subjects?
options: 50%
45%
55%
38%
None of these

quiz.text: If 30% student failed in English, 45% failed in Math and 25% failed in both then the student who pass in both subject is?
options: 38%
55%
70%
50%
None of these

quiz.text: Population of Delhi is increase 10% every year. If the current population of Delhi is 1,331,000 then what was its population 3 years ago?
options: 1000000
25000
10000000
1543200
None of these

quiz.text: A, B, C shared Rs. 18500 so that A received 25% more than B and B received 20% more than C then what amount did A received?
options: 7000
5000
7500
8000
None of these

quiz.text: If the price of a shirt is increased by 25% and then decreased by 30% then what will be effect?
options: 12% increase
12% decrease
12.5% increase
12.5% decrease
None of these

quiz.text: Nutan got 456 marks in an exam. Aditya got 54% marks in same exam which is 24 less than Nutan. The minimum passing marks in exam is 35%. Then how much marks got Nutan more than passing marks?
options: 280
456
180
176
None of these

quiz.text: 1200 boy and 650 girls appeared in examination. If 70% of boy and 40% of girls failed. Find the approximate percentage of passed students?
options: 30%
41%
50%
Can’t determine
None of these

quiz.text: Aditya's monthly salary is 15% more than Sanjay's Monthly salary if Aditya's monthly salary is 17250 then what is Sanjay's annual salary?
options: 150000
170000
180000
250000
None of these

quiz.text: The population of Delhi two years ago was 55000. It increase by 12% in the first year and decreased by 15% in the second year. What was the population of town at the end of 2 years?
options: 7084
70804
70840
Can’t determine
None of these

quiz.text: If the length of rectangle is increased by 20% and breadth is decreased by 10% then what will be impact on area?
options: 5%
10% increase
20% decrease
8% decrease
None of these

quiz.text: If the length of rectangle is increased by 20% and breadth is decreased by 10% then what will be impact on area?
options: 8% increase
20% decrease
5% increase
10% increase
None of these

quiz.text: Ram gets 20% marks more than Girish. Girish get 20% more than Sanjay. Sanjay gets 20% less than Aditya. If Ram got 576 marks and total marks were 800 then what marks did Aditya get?
options: 600
480
500
600
None of these

quiz.text: The product of one third of a number and 150% of another number is what percent of product of the given numbers?
options: 30%
35%
39%
45%
None of these

quiz.text: Ram borrowed Rs. 725 from Shyam at the beginning of a year at interest. After 8 months, he again borrowed Rs. 362.50 at a rate of interest double that the former sum bears. At the end of the year, the sum of interest on both loans is Rs. 43.50. Find the first rate of interest per annum?
options: 4.5
4.75%
6.25%
7.2%
None of these

quiz.text: The cost price of goods which are auctioned for bankruptcy is Rs. 25500 and if the goods had realised in their full value, his creditiors would have received 85 paise in the rupee. But 2/5 of the goods were sold at 17% and the remainder at 22% below their cost price. How many paise in a rupee was received by the creditors?
options: 72 paise
68 paise
55 paise
52 paise
None of these

quiz.text: A Shopkeeper undertakes to supply 2000 tables at Rs. 1725 each. He estimates that if 10% are defective which will be sold at 50%, then the profit will be 15% on his whole outlay. When the tables were supplied, 70% of the tables were found defective. What loss did the Shopkeeper incur?
options: Rs. 607500
Rs. 557500
Rs. 550500
Rs. 80680
None of these

quiz.text: Sweta invested Rs. 10,000 in a scheme exactly three years ago. The value of the investment increased by 10% during the first year, increased by 5% during the second year, and decreased by 10% during the third year. What is the value of the investment today?
options: Rs. 10,500
Rs. 10,395
Rs. 10,342
Rs. 10,230
None of these

quiz.text: In Mumbai, 60% of the registered voters are BJP-supporters and the rest are Congress-supporters. In a mayoral race, if 75% of the registered voters who are BJP-supporters and 20% of the registered voters who are Congress-supporters are expected to vote for candidate X, what percent of the registered voters are expected to vote for candidate X?
options: 53%
55%
57%
59%
None of these

quiz.text: If the profit percentage of seller A after selling item II is s% and that of seller C for the same item is (3s - 2)% and the ratio of cost price of item II by seller A and seller C is 21 : 17 then find the value of s ?
options: 2
3
4
1
none of these

quiz.text: For seller D, difference between the selling price of item II and that of item III is 4810 Rs. if the sum of the mark price of item II and item III by the same seller is 8000 then find the Mark price (in Rs.) of item II is how much more (in Rs.) than that of item III for the same seller?  (Selling price of item II is greater than that of item III)
options: 5000
6000
6500
5500
4500

quiz.text: Average SP of item II by seller A and B is Rs 4400. Average SP of item II by seller B and C is Rs 3600. Find the SP (in Rs.) of item II by seller C.
options: 4500
3600
5400
4000
6800

quiz.text: If the cost price of item I and selling price of item III by seller E are in the ratio of 5 : 6. If the seller earned a profit of 25% which is Rs. 750 on item I and 20% on item III then find the total profit (in Rs.) by selling item I and item III together by the same seller?
options: 1250
2000
1750
1350
1500

quiz.text: If Cost price of item III is 5400 Rs. for all of the sellers and all of them marked the same product at  higher than the cost price, then to get a total profit of 13500 Rs. by all of the five sellers after selling item III, what is the minimum discount (as a percentage) should be provided by seller E on item III.
options: 15%
13%
39%
20%
None of these

quiz.text: If we include the 4th quarter of the year, percentage of urban people travelled in 2nd quarter are 20% of the total urban people travelled in given year. Find the average number of urban people per quarter travelled in the given year?
options: 82.375 lakhs
84.775 lakhs
89.355 lakhs
79.525 lakhs
89.375 lakhs

quiz.text: Find the ratio between the number of urban people travelled in 1st and 3rd quarter and the number of rural people travelled in 2nd and 3rd quarter?
options: 112 : 235
235 : 112
490 : 407
407 : 490
None of these

quiz.text: If we include the 4th quarter of the year, percentage of rural people travelled in 3rd quarter will become 14% of the total rural people travelled in the given year. Then what is the number of rural people travelled in 4th quarter?
options: 250 lakhs
350 lakhs
450 lakhs
325 lakhs
Can’t determine

quiz.text: If the urban people travelled in IVth quarter is 45 lakhs less than the urban people travelled in IInd quarter. Then urban people travelled in 4th quarter are what percent of total number of urban people travelled in the given year?
options: 5.87%
8.79%
7.76%
9.87%
None of these

quiz.text: Average number of urban people travelled in 1st and 2nd quarter is how much percent less than the number of rural people in 1st quarter?

If the no. of people who are more than 50 years of age cast their votes from Goa, are 0.5 times the total number of people who are less than 51 years of age cast their vote from Uttarakhand. Then Total number of people who cast their vote from Goa in all age group are what percent of the total number of people who cast their vote from Uttarakhand in all age group ?
options: 170%
190%
210%
150%
None of these

quiz.text: If the number of people who cast their vote from U.P. in the age group of (51-70) years are 36 lakhs and the number of people who cast their vote in the age group of (18-25) years from Punjab are 100 lakh. Then find the ratio of the number of people who cast their vote from UP in  age group (18-25) years and the total number of  people who are more than 35 years of age cast their vote from Punjab.
options: 126 : 95
85 : 126
125 : 13
13 : 126
None of these

quiz.text: If total number of people who cast their vote from Punjab are 425 lakhs then  number of people of more than 35 years of age who cast their vote from the Punjab are what percent more/less than the total number of people of less than 36 years of age who cast their vote from Punjab ? (calculate upto two decimal points)
options: 47.24%
43.53%
44.28%
45.16%
38.70%

quiz.text: If the number of people who cast their vote from Manipur in the age group of 18-25 are 10.5 lakh and the no. of people who cast their vote from Goa in the age group of 51-70 are 30% more than the total number of people who cast their vote from Manipur. Then find the approximate total number of people who cast their vote from Goa in all age group ?
options: 350 lakh
288 lakh
342 lakh
338 lakh
400 lakh

quiz.text: Out of the total number of people who cast their vote from UP, 55% of them are female then find the number of female who cast their vote from UP in the age group of (71-100) if total number of people who cast their vote from UP are 300 lakh ?
options: 75 lakhs
85 lakhs
95 lakhs
Can’t determined
None of these

quiz.text:
There are some male and female employees in an office. How many female employees are there in the office? 

A. Ratio of number of male and female employees in the office is 8 : 7.

B. If one employee is selected at random from all the employees, the probability of the selected employee being male is .

C. Number of female employees in the office 12.5% is less than that of male employees in the office.
options: All the three together are not sufficient
Either A and B together or B and C together
Any two of the three together
Only A and B together
All the three together

quiz.text:
How much minimum marks is required to pass an examination?

A. Student A secured 38% marks in the examination and failed by 8 marks. Student B secured 42% marks in the same examination and got 12 more than the minimum pass marks.

B. Student A secured 35% of the total marks in the examination and failed by 23 marks. If he had secured 25 more marks his percentage of marks would have been 40%.

C. A student will be declared passed if he secures 39.60% of the total marks.
options: Any two of them
Only A
C and either A or B
Either A or B only
Any of these

quiz.text:
A company has two kinds of employees—supervisors and clerks. The total monthly salary of the employees is Rs 285000. What is the total number of employees in that company?

A. The ratio of the no. of supervisors to that of clerks in the company is 4 : 5.

B. The total monthly salary of all the supervisors is 28% more than that of clerks.

C. 20% of the clerks’ monthly salary is Rs 25000.
options: Only A and B together
Only A and C together
Only C
All statements are required
Question can’t be answered even after using all the information

quiz.text:
If the length of a rectangle is decreased by 15% and width is increased by 20%, find the change in area in terms of magnitude.

A. Breadth of the rectangle is 16 cm.

B. Length of the rectangle is 25 cm.

C. Area of the rectangle is 400 cm2.
options: A and B together or only C
Only A and B together
Any two of them
Any one of them
None of these

quiz.text:
What is the strength of female officers in Company ‘X’?

I. Male and female employees are in the ratio of 2 : 3 respectively.

II. Of the officer employees 80% are males.

III. Total number of officers is 135.
options: I and III only
II and either III or I only
All I, II and III
II and III together
Question cannot be answered even with the information in all the three statements
